intro: Chassalia bojeri var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, elongated leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster. It typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to dry conditions. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems and potential use in horticulture.
